name: Cypher Chase
description: A Digital mystery-solving game based on Cyber-Forensics, where players investigate clues, analyze data, and unravel hidden secrets to solve the case.Analyze, decrypt, and solve your way to victory!
rules: Participants must have basic technical coding knowledge and logical reasoning
Each team can consist of 3 to 4 members
Teams must report on time to the event venue
Use of unfair means, external help, internet access (unless required), AI, will lead to immediate disqualification
All participants must adhere to the time limits and instructions given by the coordinators
A student cannot be part of more than one team
All decisions regarding eligibility and final judgment rest with the faculty coordinators

name: Prompt Wars
description: Contestants use AI too..to generate outputs based on a theme. best/most creative wins.
rules: The Participants must work in teams of 2 members
Use of any AI or generative tool should strictly adhere to the event’s given guidelines
Unfair practices or plagiarism will lead to disqualification
Decisions of the judges will be final
No student can be a part of more than one team
All decisions regarding eligibility and final judgment shall rest with the faculty

name: Bug Blitz
description: Dive into a fast-paced coding challenge where precision meets pressure. Spot the flaw, fix the code, and claim victory, only the sharpest minds can squash every bug in time!
rules: Teams must report on time to the event venue
Any unfair or unethical practice will lead to disqualification
Each team’s activity will be closely monitored by coordinators
All decisions regarding eligibility and final judgment rest with the faculty coordinator
A student cannot be a part of more than one team

name: Design Escape
description: Race against time to craft stunning, user-friendly designs that solve real-world problems. Let your imagination flow, your ideas stand out, and your visuals speak louder than words. Only the most innovative minds will escape the ordinary!
rules: Each team must consist of 1-2 members
The design must be created during the event — no pre-made templates or reused work allowed
Use of AI is prohibited
Participants may use any of the approved tools: Canva, Figma, or Sketch
Teams must submit their design file or prototype link before time runs out
The decision of the judges will be final
Participants can use personal laptops with design tools pre-installed or use online access

name: Flip the Script
description: Participants first argue for a given topic, presenting strong points in its favor. When the host announces “switch,” they must instantly shift and argue against the same topic with equal conviction. This format tests quick thinking, adaptability, and the ability to see both sides of an argument.
rules: This is an individual event
Topics will be given on the spot
Each participant gets 3 minutes of preparation time before speaking
Total speaking time: 4 to 6 minutes
The host can call “Switch!” at any point — multiple times during the round

name: Trivia Trek
description: A cinematic trivia challenge spanning the finest moments of world cinema. Test your knowledge, crack clues, and outsmart the rest in this Trivia Trek
rules: Questions will span topics from Movies, Songs, Sports, Books, and Classic Trivia
Each correct answer carries 1 point, unless otherwise specified
Participants must respond within the time limit announced by the co-ordinators
No use of phones, gadgets, or external help is permitted during the quiz
Once an answer is submitted or time is up, no changes can be made
Each team is allowed to raise hands only if they know the answer
Only one person from a team is supposed to raise their hand
Participants are requested to raise their hands only upon reading the question. In case of repeated hand-raising, points will be deducted
No negative points for wrong answers
In case of a tie, tie-breaker questions will determine the winner
Participants must maintain decorum, discipline, and fair play throughout the event
Any act of cheating, arguing, or disrupting the flow of the game will result in immediate disqualification
Prompting or whispering answers to others during the quiz is strictly prohibited
All participants are expected to uphold the spirit of healthy competition and fun that defines Trivia Trek

name: IPL Auction
description: The IPL Auction brings the thrill of strategy and bidding as teams compete to build their dream squads. Get ready for high stakes, surprises, and the excitement of cricket’s biggest marketplace
fee: Team of 2 - ₹140 Team of 3 - ₹180 Team of 4 - ₹200
rules: Teams can consist of 2, 3 or 4 members
Each team can select only a maximum of 11 players only
Any doubts should be cleared only to the event coordinators
Teams cannot exceed the given budget of ₹80 crores
The overall statistics of each of the 11 players in the team will be taken into consideration (6 Indians & max of 5 foreigners)
Allowed team size: 4 players(max) or 2 (min)per team
A player can participate in only one team

name: Ship Wreck
description: Each participant is a famous character (Thanos, Messi, Einstein, Barbie), they must convince the judges why they deserve the last spot on a sinking ship. Super fun + creative acting!
rules: Participants must choose or be assigned a unique character — no duplicates
The argument should be original and in sync with the chosen character’s personality
Bonus points for improvisation, witty comebacks, and dramatic flair
Exceeding time limits or breaking character will result in point deductions
Use of inappropriate or offensive language will lead to disqualification
Decision of the judges will be final and binding

name: FIFA
description: Kick, Score and Conquer the digital pitch of the football simulation video game. Face off in the ultimate FIFA showdown — every goal counts, every move matters.
rules: The event will be conducted on PlayStation
Players must use the same console and controls provided at the venue
No custom teams or edited players are allowed , only standard club or national teams
Match settings will be uniform for all games (5 to 6 minutes per half for round one and a full match for round two)
Players must report 10 minutes before their scheduled match
Any unfair or unsportsmanlike conduct will lead to immediate disqualification
Decisions made by coordinators and judges are final
Participation type: Duo Event (2 players per entry)
All technical decisions and tie-breaker rules will be handled by the event coordinators
No participant can register for multiple slots

name: BGMI
description: Battle it out in the BGMI arena and prove you’ve got what it takes to survive the storm. We got supplies, show your strategy, aim, and teamwork in this high-stakes BGMI clash.
fee: Team of 2 - ₹140 Team of 3 - ₹180 Team of 4 - ₹200
rules: The first round of the event is based on battle royale i.e Room Match
Per kills/eliminations by a participant will be counted as 1 point
Player limit for first round is 100
Any team or player of the team caught using any hacks will be disqualified from the event

name: Valorant
description: Team up, strategize, and battle your way to victory in this ultimate Valorant showdown. Compete in an action-packed Valorant tournament and show who truly holds the spike!
rules: Each team must consist of 5 players
Players must use their own Laptops/PCs and Riot accounts and are responsible for keeping them in working condition
Participants will be playing from their respective place of residence and ensure that they have a proper internet connection
Each team will get 2 tactical timeouts (1min) per match
If a player disconnects, a 5-minute reconnection time will be given, after which a substitute player should take his place, or the team must play one man down
The decision of the coordinators will be final and binding
Allowed team size: 5 players per team
